promo-block.details: The Hickory Driver License Office will temporarily close for equipment installation and renovations on Thursday, October 27. It is scheduled to re-open on Monday October 31, at 8:00 a.m.

item.button-text: What is the difference between a UAS/drone and a model plane?
item.details: A model aircraft is a UAS that is flown solely for hobby or recreational purposes and is not used for any monetary or business means.

item.button-text: Do I need an exemption or license to fly if I'm only flying for recreational purposes?
item.details: No. However, the Federal Aviation Administration says that UAS/drones should be flown a sufficient distance from populated areas. Recreational users should always fly their aircraft during the day, within their visual line of sight and should only fly aircraft that weigh less than 55 pounds (unless certified by an aeromodelling community-based organization and is not being used for business purposes). For more information, visit the FAA's webpage on hobby and recreational flying.

item.button-text: What is an Unmanned Aircraft System (UAS)?
item.details: Commonly referred to as drones, North Carolina law defines a UAS as 'unmanned aircraft and associated elements, including communication links and components that control the unmanned aircraft that are required for the pilot in command to operate safely and efficiently in the national airspace system.'

item.button-text: What is the difference between a UAS/drone and a model plane?
item.details: A model aircraft is a UAS that is flown solely for hobby or recreational purposes and is not used for any monetary or business means.

item.button-text: Do I need an exemption or license to fly if I'm only flying for recreational purposes?
item.details: No. However, the Federal Aviation Administration says that UAS/drones should be flown a sufficient distance from populated areas. Recreational users should always fly their aircraft during the day, within their visual line of sight and should only fly aircraft that weigh less than 55 pounds (unless certified by an aeromodelling community-based organization and is not being used for business purposes). For more information, visit the FAA's webpage on hobby and recreational flying.
